feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission clearly implements a working financial application: it accepts financial inputs, computes metrics, generates an investment plan via AI, and outputs results to Google Sheets (Implement evidence). The Discover and Reflect stages confirm the project goal and that it produces substantive financial recommendations, satisfying the criterion that the tool functions as a financial app.
- Integrate AI: The submission demonstrates concrete AI integration in the workflow (AI generates personalized investment plans from form inputs and outputs them to Google Sheets) and produces substantive, detailed outputs (executive summary, prioritized actions, allocation recommendations). Reflection indicates the student understands the AI’s role and value, so the integration is effective and meets PASS criteria.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "Hi. So today my project for the capstone is a personalized investment plan um maker."

"So basically you have a form here where uh you put in your information um your financial information uh kind of configures it and stores that checks if you have all the required fields um gives you an error if you don't. If you do have everything goes ahead and calculates the financial metrics uh and then uses AI to generate the actual investment plan. and then finally spits it back out into Google Sheets."
"I learned I learned a bit about the different plans that you can actually invest in"
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: student defines the tool as a personalized investment-plan maker (intent and target users).
- Implement: student describes the working workflow (form input, calculations, AI generation, Google Sheets output) demonstrating the app functions.
- Reflect: student discusses learning about investment plans, indicating meaningful financial content and application.
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly implements a working financial application: it accepts financial inputs, computes metrics, generates an investment plan via AI, and outputs results to Google Sheets (Implement evidence). The Discover and Reflect stages confirm the project goal and that it produces substantive financial recommendations, satisfying the criterion that the tool functions as a financial app.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "so then you click submit. Gives you form submitted. then basically goes through does all those things I was talking about earlier and then it takes a minute to go through the actual AI of generating the investment."
"my project for the capstone is a personalized investment plan um maker."

"it starts comprehensive investment plan. Prepared for the inputs you had. ... gives you the executive summary. So gives you the top three priority actions you need to uh go through. So the immediate one it tells us is to establish an emergency fund."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover — identified the product goal (personalized investment plan maker).  
Implement — integrated AI into the submission workflow to generate plans and output to Sheets.  
Reflect — commented on how AI responses differ from manual research and what was learned.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates concrete AI integration in the workflow (AI generates personalized investment plans from form inputs and outputs them to Google Sheets) and produces substantive, detailed outputs (executive summary, prioritized actions, allocation recommendations). Reflection indicates the student understands the AI’s role and value, so the integration is effective and meets PASS criteria.
